Articles.Content:
I have something special for you, The Tornado 1 from Sonic 2 and 3 and the Sonic the Hedgehog the movie.

After watching Sonic the Hedgehog the movie today (witch is great by the way) i felt like it was time for me to build the original Tornado in KSP.

And i must say i think ive fallen in love with this aircraft . Its super fun to fly (maby even a bit better than the Tornado 5), aka its very responsive and sharp at the same time (could use a bit more roll control) making it very manouverable. Its pretty much the perfect aerobatic aircraft .

NOTE: as soon as the wheels leave the ground the aircraft will start pointing its nose up because of jet booster under the wing so taking of is not as easy as it may seem. I suggest pointing the nose down as hard as you can and as soon as the nose points straight up just do a loop de loop and you will be fine.

Plus when you land, land at a very slow speed and be very, VERY creful with the brakes or it WILL flip over.

The design of the aircraft is pretty much as accurate as it can be and even the colours too witch is suprising. Other than the vertical stabilizer being grey instead of red with a white stripe and the wheel hubs being red instead of grey/silver it pretty much bang on.

Here are some picks of it in action.

Everybody better buckle up and hang on, looking at you Bob. unfotunetly soon after takeoff Bob desided to leave.

Good thing Bob wasnt with us at this point or he could have gotten a new haircut.

And what would a tornado be without a tails flag. So i will be putting my flag up for download.

Credits to nintendrawer of deviantart for the original picture.

So there it is for you, the Tornado 1 from the pages of gaming history in KSP form. I hope you enjoy it .

Mods used: Firespitter, Prosedural wings, KAX and Flag decals
